text: Charles Grethen (born 2 June 1992 in Tuntange) is a Luxembourgian middle- distance runner competing primarily in the 800 metres. He represented his country at three consecutive European Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2009 |European Youth Olympic Festival |Tampere, Finland |6th (h) |800 m |1:57.6h |- |2010 |World Junior Championships |Moncton, Canada |17th (sf) |800 m |1:52.09 |- |2012 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |35th (h) |800 m |1:53.22 |- |2013 |European U23 Championships |Tampere, Finland |16th (h) |800 m |1:50.01 |- |2014 |European Championships |Zürich, Switzerland |31st (h) |800 m |1:50.36 |- |2015 |Universiade |Gwangju, South Korea |14th (sf) |800 m |1:49.31 |- |rowspan=2|2016 |European Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |13th (sf) |800 m |1:49.40 |- |Olympic Games |Rio de Janeiro, Brazil |38th (h) |800 m |1:48.93 |- |rowspan=2|2017 |Games of the Small States of Europe |Serravalle, San Marino |bgcolor=silver|2nd |800 m |1:50.70 |- |Universiade |Taipei, Taiwan |5th |1500 m |3:44.59 |- |2018 |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |25th (h) |1500 m |3:49.97 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *800 metres – 1:46.44 (Oordegem-Lede 2016) *1000 metres – 2:18.95 (Pliezhausen 2016) Indoor *800 metres – 1:48.26 (Metz 2016) *1500 metres – 3:45.05 (Düsseldorf 2016) ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Luxembourgian male middle-distance runners Category:People from Mersch (canton) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Luxembourg Category:Competitors at the 2015 Summer Universiade Category:Competitors at the 2017 Summer Universiade
title: Charles Grethen
